DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether contraceptive compliance by young women can be improved through expanded counseling by a health educator at the initial clinic visit as compared with standard care.
DOC.brief_title: Improving Adolescent Adherence to Hormonal Contraception
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Sexually active females 16 to 24 years of age who present to a University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB) clinic and request to initiate oral contraception for birth control. Exclusion criteria: Women who are currently pregnant or breastfeeding. Women who wish to become pregnant within the next 12 months. Women who have a medical contraindication to use of estrogen (e.g., thromboembolic disease, acute liver disease, breast cancer, genital cancer, or undiagnosed genital bleeding). Women wishing to initiate use of a contraceptive method that is not oral, such as transdermal (the patch) or injectable (DMPA) methods, or the vaginal ring. Current and previous users of oral contraceptives.
